description: The driver/agent generate this trap when a
stack unit operational status is down.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD F10-M-SERIES-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmStackUnitDown F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarInteger i 9999 F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarString s EXAMPLE F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarSlot i 9999 F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarPort i 9999

description: An generic integer value in the TRAP object
variables.name: F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarInteger

description: An generic string value in the TRAP object
variables.name: F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarString

description: The chassis slot number.
For the traps that does not have slot information the value will
-1 in the TRAP PDU.
variables.name: F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarSlot

description: The chassis port number.
For the traps that does not have port information the value will
-1 in the TRAP PDU.
variables.name: F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarPort

description: The driver/agent generate this trap when a
stack unit is not the same code as a management
stack.

description: The driver/agent generate this trap when a stack unit role is changed.

event.Summary: Stack unit role has changed to $v1

description: Indicates whether the unit is a Management Unit,
a Stack Unit, or unassigned.
Setting this object to mgmtUnit(1) initiates transfer of the
management functionality to the specified stack unit.
Object values stackUnit(2) and unassigned(3) cannot be set.
variables.name: F10-M-SERIES-CHASSIS-MIB::chStackUnitMgmtStatus

description: An generic string value in the TRAP object
variables.name: F10-CHASSIS-MIB::chAlarmVarString
